value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><add place="inline">If</add> The grave Elizabethan house, <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-pens" key="Penshurst Place">Penshurst</rs>, within, as we</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">see it now, looks out of proportion, <del>it is because</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">with its surroundings, it is because <del>the rela</del> <del>its</del> <add place="above">the</add> connection</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">with the <del>village is</del> great house & the village is lost.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">If we could see it <del>as it was when in being</del></l>

<del xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <l><del>as the airman sees it</del> as it <del>was when</del> in being we</l>
            <l>should see the <del>the</del> <del>farm, the cottage,</del> <del>roads</del> as an</l>
          </del>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">airman sees the foundations of old towns</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">still <del>existing</del> marked on the fields, we should see</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>the</del> <del>great</del> tracks leading from the farm & the cottage;</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">we should see the great house as an oasis in the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">in the midst of wild country;</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">If we could see the great house as it was <del>when <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-espe" key="Spenser, Edmund">Spenser</rs></del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>in the</del> in the time of <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-espe" key="Spenser, Edmund">Spenser</rs>, we should see</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">tracks, <del>leading fro</del> raying out to farms, <add place="above">&</add> to cottages, to</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">& barns. <del>We should see it like a <del>green</del> oasis in</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>the middle of a desert.</del> The <del>[close?]</del> It was</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">It <del>it was [meaning?]</del> <add place="above">If</add> of the great house were to</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"> [detect?] the <del>enemy that it should</del> the enemy, [man?]</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">that there <del>should</del> <add place="above">was</add> be armour in the church: to</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">fight against hunger in winter there should be grain in the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">barn. The common fight linked the great house to the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">small. It is that connection <del>that is detailed</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>in so many</del> between master & man that is</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>seen</del> <del>detail</del> <del>detailed so painfully & minutely in the</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">medieval <del>account books, inventories,</del> that is</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">so minutely & painfully revealed <del>in the innumerable</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">in the <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-past" key="Paston Letters">Paston</rs> letters: it makes the staple of</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">medieval correspondence. But there was</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">also the other connection – <del>there was</del> the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">common belief: that bond between the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">great house & the small has been <del>obli</del> covered</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">over. <del>Just as the antiquaries</del>, <del>so that</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">like the <del>pilgrims way,</del> <del>which is</del> <del>old</del>track</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>road</del> under the hill, <del>now</del> along which <del>we are</del> <add place="above">once</add></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>trod by [regular?]</del> the <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-cant" key="Canterbury Tales, The">Pilgrims</rs> rode to <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-cant" key="Canterbury">Canterbury</rs></l>
